alert.note: Alert for Butler; Ohio (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 03 at 12:19PM EST until March 03 at 12:45PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM CST FOR WESTERN BUTLER AND OHIO COUNTIES... At 1119 AM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Hartford to near Central City to 7 miles south of Dunmor, moving northeast at 90 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Hartford, Beaver Dam, Fordsville, Centertown, Mchenry, Rockport, Rochester, Mining City, Ralph and Heflin. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Louisville. Intense thunderstorm lines can produce brief tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, it is best to move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These storms may cause serious injury and significant property damage.
